body:
I managed to replicate this on my google drive (I have a Pixel 2 XL which produces these photos).

```
2018/04/05 11:00:05 ERROR : MVIMG_20180228_080548.jpg: corrupted on transfer: MD5 hash differ "f3daaa7571cfab51bd75bc0b6483e314" vs "d56f98347be7ee80558ed70d63bde291"
2018/04/05 11:00:05 INFO  : MVIMG_20180228_080548.jpg: Removing failed copy
```

However I note that all the files I tried in March (from 17th onwards) were OK so maybe this is a bug which got fixed at some point.  Do you have a time range for the failing files?
I do agree with you.  It does seem that its functioning from that time-ish forward.  Mine was a bit later than March 17th (22nd) but all files since then are fine.  I think we can close this.

OK I'll close this then - it will be in the archives for people to find then.

Thanks for testing.

I too have a Pixel 2 and am experiencing this issue and only *moving images* (a feature introduced with the Pixel 2) from Feb and Mar 2018 in the "Photos" special sync folder in Drive appear to be causal. This is an "IO error" in rclone and so subcommand "sync" always politely refuses to delete any removed files from the destination. I'm trying to figure out whether the best workaround is to do `rclone sync --ignore-checksum` once to obtain a copy of all files and delete the removed files, and then drop the movie part of those images in Photos and try again.
Chiming in to confirm that a single `--ignore-checksum` sync fixed it for all future runs for me, as well - what a relief that these sudden checksum errors weren't actually a failing hard drive ðŸ˜„

This is not just pertaining to JPGs but also happens to MP4, MOV and other video streams which I'm presuming google is transcoding for different bitrates etc.

While not ideal, performing ``--ignore-checksum`` will download the file correctly and the video is confirmed playable.

To prevent just ignoring all files, it would be great if there was an ```--ignore-checksum-google-photos``` where this would only apply to those in the ":/Google Photos/" folder, as this folder is specifically pertaining to the cause of the issue.

> To prevent just ignoring all files, it would be great if there was an `--ignore-checksum-google-photos` where this would only apply to those in the ":/Google Photos/" folder, as this folder is specifically pertaining to the cause of the issue.

This should maybe be a backend option for the google drive backend.  I wonder how easy it is to tell google photos apart from other files...

Want to work on that @jammin84 ?

Hi @ncw 

I'm in no way a coder especially in Go. 

Regardless, I had a look over the API and git and have come up with this. Not sure if it is any way suitable or complete and is untested.

https://github.com/ncw/rclone/compare/master...jammin84:patch-1

In simple it is just skipping any photo or video that google mime-types as such.
Wow -- how convenient that Google Drive has a special MIME type for photos and videos that come from Google Photos :open_mouth:

@jammin84 
> I'm in no way a coder especially in Go.

Your code says otherwise ;-)
 
> Regardless, I had a look over the API and git and have come up with this. Not sure if it is any way suitable or complete and is untested.
> 
> [master...jammin84:patch-1](https://github.com/ncw/rclone/compare/master...jammin84:patch-1)
> 
> In simple it is just skipping any photo or video that google mime-types as such.

That looks like it would almost work!  (I don't think it will compile but it is close).

Do you want me to take that and make it work?  Or would you like to submit a pull request and I'll help you fix it up?

issue.title: GoogleDrive - MD5checksum skip for google photos and videos. #2207

repository.name: rclone
repository.description: "rsync for cloud storage" - Google Drive, S3, Dropbox, Backblaze B2, One Drive, Swift, Hubic, Wasabi, Google Cloud Storage, Azure Blob, Azure Files, Yandex Files

issue.body:
GoogleDrive - MD5checksum skip for google photos and videos.


proposed fix for issue #2207 - untested

<!--
Thank you very much for contributing code or documentation to rclone! Please
fill out the following questions to make it easier for us to review your
changes.

You do not need to check all the boxes below all at once, feel free to take
your time and add more commits. If you're done and ready for review, please
check the last box.
-->

#### What is the purpose of this change?

<!--
Skip MD5 checksum on photos or videos sync'd from googleDrive due to known issues
-->

#### Was the change discussed in an issue or in the forum before?

<!--
proposed fix for issue #2207
-->

#### Checklist

- [ ] I'm done, this Pull Request is ready for review :-)

body:
Thank you, thats very kind.

I created the pull request to get the ball rolling on it. Please fix and test as needed.

> Thank you, thats very kind.
> 
> I created the pull request to get the ball rolling on it. Please fix and test as needed.

Do you want me to take it from here - I'm very happy to do that.

@jammin84 I made your code compile, but then I found it didn't work alas, the mime types from google photos don't seem to be anything other than `image/jpeg` etc.

I did figure out a way of doing it though by looking at which `space` the file was in

I'd appreciate testers for this with and the `--skip-checksum-gphotos` flag

https://beta.rclone.org/branch/v1.46.0-076-g2aa6b7f8-fix-2207-gphotos-checksum-beta/ (uploaded in 15-30 mins)
